Name: National Association of Realtors
Description: For a wide range of national real estate residential market statistics, commentaries, and outlooks.
Use Case: Brokers can access the REALTOR Confidence Index, median home prices by county nationally, the Housing Affordability Index and more.

Name: REBNY
Description: New York-based association for the real estate industry.
Use Case: Brokers can access the quarterly construction pipeline report, retail reports and confidence indicies.

Name: Miami Association of Realtors
Description: Residential information for South Florida counties.
Use Case: Brokers can see monthly real estate statistical reports for South Florida.

Name: National Assoication of Realtors: Chicago
Description: Insights into the fundamentals and direction of the largest metropolitan housing markets in the U.S.
Use Case: These local reports look at various factors affecting home prices, such as: health of the local job market; foreclosure rates; housing inventory; debt-to-income and mortgage-servicing-costs-to-income ratios.
Notes: I would change to National Association of Realtors: Local Reports to show they have more than just Chicago here. The logo is the same as NAR.

Name: Council on Tall Buildings & Urban Habitat
Description: Organization representing city developers.
Use Case: The council publishes trends in the tallest cities globally plus completion rates.

Name: Florida Realtors
Description: Organization for Florida-based real estate agents.
Use Case: Brokers can look into monthly, quarterly and annual data for single-family, condo/townhouse and manufactured home sales.

Name: Chicago Association of Realtors
Description: Organization for Chicago-based real estate agents.
Use Case: This group offers monthly indicators on the state of Chicago's 77 neighborhoods and has an interactive map to look into neighborhood-specific data further.

Name: Illinois Realtors
Description: Organization for Illinois-based real estate agents.
Use Case: Brokers can look at monthly closed sales, monthly closed sales and their changes year over year, median sales price data and more.

Name: California Association of Realtors
Description: Organization for California-based real estate agents.
Use Case: Brokers can tap into an interactive map showing local data, a tool that looks at monthly housing supply, CAR's monthly housing overview reports and more.

Name: Commercial Real Estate Development Association
Description: Organization for commercial real estate developers.
Use Case: Developers can tap into forecasts diving into office and industrial demand.

Name: International Council of Shopping Centers
Description: Organization for the retail and retail real estate industries.
Use Case: Offers yearly Black Friday shopping forecast and a monthly industry benchmark report.

Name: American Institute of Architects
Description: Organization for U.S. architechts.
Use Case: Provides business conditions reports and monthly construction updates.

Name: Society of Office and Industrial Realtors
Description: Organization for office and industrial real estate brokers.
Use Case: Provides regular sector-wide forecast reports.

Name: Property Shark
Description: Real estate map and database with a range of metrics.
Use Case: Real estate database and property research tool that provides building details, ownership information, comparable sales.

Name: Crexi
Description: Commercial real estate marketplace.
Use Case: Offers listings along with industry reports.

Name: MSCI
Description: Provides a range of data on private market investing.
Use Case: Their commercial property price index looks at changes in commerical real estate pricing.

Name: Attom Data
Description: Provider of nationwide property data.
Use Case: APIs, bulk data, and cloud real estate data.

Name: Trepp
Description: National debt data.
Use Case: Provides a range of data on everything related to commerical real estate loans: rates, delinquinces, asset-class-specific data, etc.

Name: Morningstar
Description: News and analysis on the stock market.
Use Case: Provides data on how real estate is performing compared to the rest of the market, along with analysis on top REITs to buy, etc.

Name: Kroll Bond Rating Agency
Description: Loan-rating agency.
Use Case: Provides CMBS and RMBS ratings and analysis.

Name: Institute of Real Estate Management
Description: Organization for property and asset managers.
Use Case: Provides reports on compensation, insurance costs for housing providers, etc.

Name: Wealth-X
Description: Solutions to help brokers who work with wealthy individuals.
Use Case: Provides reports on wealth and luxury real estate.

Name: Local Logic
Description: Location intelligence data provider.
Use Case: The Insights Atlas provides hyperlocal information on any location in the U.S. and Canada.

Name: Statista
Description: Platform that provides facts and figures for a range of industries.
Use Case: Residential and commercial market analyses.

Name: Condo Vultures
Description: Analysis on Miami's condo market.
Use Case: Market intelligence report is released monthly.

Name: Crunchbase
Description: Venture capital database.
Use Case: APIs and bulk data on venture capital and start-ups.

Name: CB Insights
Description: Platform with research on tech companies, with a focus on artificial intelligence.
Use Case: Publishes various reports on the rise of artifical intelligence in emerging tech firms/industries.

Name: Mashvisor
Description: Platform for the investment property/vacation rental industry.
Use Case: Publishes rankings for vacation rental industry like top places to buy rental property, top lenders, etc.

Name: VTS
Description: Commercial real estate proptech platform.
Use Case: Publishes trend articles in the proptech space.

Name: Red IQ
Description: Platform for underwriting institutional multifamily deals.
Use Case: Owners can screen deals faster.

Name: PiinPoint
Description: Location data provider.
Use Case: Developers can look into a location's raffic analysis, demographic data, nearby brands and more.

Name: Regis Online
Description: Platform that validates locations for commercial real estate projects.
Use Case: Developers can make maps to visualize location data, locate customers in markets, etc.
Notes: I used the Regis logo vs. Sites USA - let me know if you'd like me to switch.

Name: Yardi Matrix
Description: Commercial real estate data, research and market reports.
Use Case: Publishes monthly commercial real estate data on a range of sectors including storage, multifamily, etc.

Name: CCIM Institute
Description: Association for the commercial real estate industry.
Use Case: Publishes trends on the commercial real estate industry.

Name: Home Buying Institute
Description: U.S. residential news aimed at educating home buyers.
Use Case: Newsletter and website provide a range of residential market news for consumers.

Name: Realtors Land Institute
Description: Resources for land real estate.
Use Case: Offers a land consultant finder, annual land market survey, etc.

Name: Deloitte
Description: Accounting and consulting firm for a range of industries.
Use Case: Publishes reports on various real estate issues and sectors, along with financial services.

Name: Insitute for Housing Studies at DePaul University
Description: Publisher of the Cook County House Price Index .
Use Case: This index tracks quarterly price trends for single family homes in 33 submarkets in the City of Chicago and suburban Cook County.

Name: Livabl
Description: Database of new home construction.
Use Case: Provides a look at new residential developments around the country.

Name: Nancy Packes
Description: Residential consultant and agent on new or re-use developments.
Use Case: Publishes NYC development pipeline and transactions databases.

Name: MarketProof
Description: NYC sale, listings and building information provider.
Use Case: Publishes databases of developments in pipeline and transactions.

Name: Urban Digs
Description: NYC real estate analytics and insights provider that uses artificial intelligence.
Use Case: Publishes msnapshots for Manhattan and Brooklyn, including data like the number of monthly closed sales and sales that closed over their asking prices.

Name: SafeGraph
Description: Provides accurate point of interest and foot traffic data in markets.
Use Case: Brokers, buyers, developers, and investors can see foot traffic near or at properties of interest.

Name: Replica
Description: Provides weekly mobility and economic insights, nationwide, at census-tract level fidelity.
Use Case: Some use case examples: analyzing how many peoplke take public transit in an area, analyzing weekend vs. weekday spend in a neighorhood, analyzing travel patterns in cities.

Name: Placer. ai
Description: Provides consumer foot-traffic data.
Use Case: Developers and brokers can find unique oppertunities based on highly accurate foot traffic data. Investors and developers will also find this useful in evaluating new projects.

Name: Opportunity Insights
Description: This website contains datasets which track the economic impacts of COVID-19 on people, businesses, and communities across the United States in real time.
Use Case: Brokers, investors, and developers can quickly see a high level over view of the effects of COVID and how things change moving forward, which can serve as a useful market benchmark as well as provide a better perspective on the time horizon for future deals at prior volumes
Notes: Tracker no longer appears up to date. Consider deleting.

Name: Walk Score
Description: For tracking foot traffic at retail hubs or any location.
Use Case: Brokers can find foot traffic numbers for properties.

Name: RentCast
Description: For rent estimates on properties.
Use Case: Brokers can find rent estimates.
Notes: Formerly Rapid - their rent estimate API will be discontinued on 3/1/2025.

Name: DashCMA (requires payment)
Description: Tool for pricing homes
Use Case: Helps agents to better price homes
Notes: Shut down? Possibly acquired by Inside Real Estate...

Name: SmartZip Analytics
Description: Predictive marketing tool.
Use Case: Helps brokers to target homeowners who are most likely to sell their proeprties.

Name: Preqin
Description: Alternative investment research specialists who provide contact details and full investment history of investors.
Use Case: Gives investors access to investment history, future plans and contact details of real estate funds.

Name: Dodge Construction Network
Description: Construction data and analytics firm.
Use Case: Firms can get leads on construction projects.

Name: Dun & Bradstreet (formerly Hoovers)
Description: Commercial data and analytics.
Use Case: For finance firms: due diligence (review company financials and risks), operations (regulatory compliance).

Name: Esri
Description: Location mapping software.
Use Case: For developers: site selection.

Name: Mergent Online
Description: Provides financial information on U.S. and Canadian companies.
Use Case: For investors: due diligence; provides info like balance sheet and cash statements.

Name: LexisNexis
Description: Legal and business research platform.
Use Case: Users can dig deep into lawsuits and company information.

Name: ISS Governance
Description: Analyzes the governance of companies.
Use Case: Investors can identify a company's governance risks.

Name: LSEG Data & Analytics
Description: Data platform covering investment banks, funds, commodities, etc.

Name: Nasdaq
Description: Provides data on performance of indices and public companies.

Name: FamilySearch

Use Case: Brokers can get leads from list of births, marriages, deaths, etc.

Name: Estated

Name: Reonomy
